intro: Arabis muralis subsp. rosea, commonly known as the rose-colored rockcress, is a low-growing perennial plant native to rocky and gravelly habitats in Europe. It features basal rosettes of fleshy, spoon-shaped leaves that are typically bluish-green in color. The plant produces clusters of small, showy flowers in shades of pink to rose-red, which bloom in early spring. It is adapted to thrive in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in alpine or coastal environments. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in rock gardens.
